intro: Asplenium ducis aprutii, commonly known as the Umbrian water fern, is a rare and endangered species native to the mountainous regions of central Italy. It is a member of the fern family (Polypodiaceae) and is characterized by its delicate, finely divided fronds that resemble those of other water ferns. This plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, such as along streams and in rocky crevices, where it can access the moisture it requires. Its unique morphology and limited distribution make it a subject of interest for botanists studying rare flora. Conservation efforts are ongoing to protect this species from habitat loss and environmental degradation.
